content.text:
Erstelle eine moderne Social-Media-Plattform namens KickR für den Fußballbereich.
KickR vernetzt Trainer, Vereine und Sponsoren und bietet gleichzeitig eine Lernplattform für Trainer.

Die App soll ähnlich wie Facebook funktionieren:
	•	Benutzerprofile
	•	Freundschaftsanfragen
	•	News Feed mit Beiträgen
	•	Likes, Kommentare & Teilen
	•	Private Nachrichten (Chat)

Zusätzlich soll es einen Training Hub geben, in dem Trainer Trainingsübungen mit Text, Bildern und Videos veröffentlichen können, damit andere Trainer davon lernen.

Außerdem enthält KickR einen Sponsoring-Marktplatz, über den Vereine und Trainer Sponsorenpakete erstellen können, die Sponsoren annehmen oder anfragen können.
Der Betreiber von KickR erhält eine Provision pro Sponsoring-Deal.

⸻

🟢 User Roles

Erstelle folgende Benutzerrollen:
	1.	Admin / Owner
	•	Nutzer verwalten
	•	Inhalte moderieren
	•	Sponsoring-Deals einsehen
	•	Provisionen verwalten
	2.	Trainer
	•	Eigenes Profil
	•	Trainings posten
	•	Beiträge erstellen
	•	Freunde hinzufügen
	•	Nachrichten schreiben
	3.	Verein
	•	Vereinsprofil
	•	Trainings & Beiträge posten
	•	Sponsorenpakete erstellen
	•	Sponsoren annehmen
	•	Chat mit Sponsoren
	4.	Sponsor
	•	Sponsorenprofil
	•	Sponsorenpakete durchsuchen
	•	Pakete anfragen oder annehmen
	•	Chat mit Vereinen/Trainern

⸻

🟢 Training Hub – Inhalte & Felder

Trainings sind ein eigener Content-Bereich mit folgenden Feldern:
	•	Titel
	•	Ziel (z. B. Technik, Taktik, Passspiel, Pressing)
	•	Team-/Altersklasse (Dropdown):
	•	G-Jugend
	•	F-Jugend
	•	E-Jugend
	•	D-Jugend
	•	C-Jugend
	•	B-Jugend
	•	A-Jugend
	•		2.	Mannschaft
	•		1.	Mannschaft
	•	Frauen (Seniorinnen)
	•	AH / Alte Herren
	•	Zusatzfeld bei Jugend (Pflicht):
	•	Jungs
	•	Mädels
	•	Gemischt
	•	Dauer
	•	Spieleranzahl
	•	Materialliste
	•	Beschreibung (Schritt-für-Schritt)
	•	Bilder & Videos

Funktionen:
	•	Kommentieren
	•	Liken
	•	Speichern
	•	Teilen

⸻

🟢 Sponsoring-Marktplatz

Erstelle einen Marktplatz mit folgenden Funktionen:

Sponsorenpakete:
	•	Paketname (z. B. Bronze / Silber / Gold / Individuell)
	•	Preis
	•	Laufzeit
	•	Region
	•	Leistungen (Text)
	•	Medien (Bilder)
	•	Verfügbarkeit

Deal-Ablauf:
	1.	Sponsor sendet Anfrage oder nimmt Paket an
	2.	Chat zwischen Sponsor & Verein/Trainer
	3.	Deal-Status:
	•	Angefragt
	•	Verhandlung
	•	Akzeptiert
	•	Aktiv
	•	Abgeschlossen

Provision:
	•	Betreiber erhält automatisch eine Provision pro Deal (einstellbar)

⸻

🟢 Hauptseiten & Navigation

Erstelle folgende Seiten:
	•	Startseite / Feed
	•	Training Hub
	•	Training erstellen
	•	Sponsoren entdecken
	•	Sponsorenpaket erstellen
	•	Profil (eigen & andere)
	•	Freunde / Anfragen
	•	Nachrichten
	•	Benachrichtigungen
	•	Einstellungen
	•	Admin Dashboard

⸻

🟢 Design & Stil
	•	Modernes, sportliches Design
	•	Farben: Grün + Weiß + Dunkelgrau
	•	Mobile-First
	•	Klare Buttons & Karten-Layout
	•	Fußball-Icons & Social-Media-Elemente

⸻

🟢 Monetarisierung
	•	Provision auf Sponsoring-Deals
	•	Optional: Premium-Profile für mehr Sichtbarkeit

⸻

🟢 Ziel

KickR soll eine zentrale Plattform für Trainer, Vereine & Sponsoren werden und besonders unerfahrenen Trainern helfen, sich weiterzuentwickeln.

⸻

✅ Tipp für Appy Pie

Wenn Appy Pie nach Features fragt, aktiviere:
	•	Login / Signup
	•	Social Feed
	•	Chat / Messaging
	•	Media Upload
	•	Admin Panel
	•	Payments / Monetarisierung
	•	Push Notifications

Okay, I will create a plan for building KickR, a modern social media platform for the football community, connecting trainers, clubs, and sponsors, and offering a learning platform for trainers.

**Features for the First Version:**

*   **User Profiles & Social Feed:** Implement user profiles with the ability to add friends, a news feed displaying posts, and features for liking, commenting, and sharing content.
*   **Training Hub:** Develop a section where trainers can share training exercises with text, images, and videos.
*   **Sponsorship Marketplace:** Create a marketplace where clubs and trainers can create sponsorship packages for sponsors to accept or request.

**Design Elements:**

*   **Colors:**
    *   Background: `#FFFFFF` (White)
    *   Text: `#333333` (Dark Gray)
    *   TextSecondary: `#666666` (Medium Gray)
    *   Primary: `#2ecc71` (Green)
    *   Secondary: `#f39c12` (Orange - for highlights)
    *   Accent: `#3498db` (Blue - for interactive elements)
    *   Card: `#f0f0f0` (Light Gray)
    *   Highlight: `#27ae60` (Darker Green)
*   **Typography:** Use modern, clean fonts like "System", "Roboto", or "Arial" for readability and a sporty feel.

**Plan:**

1.  **Project Setup:** Ensure the Expo project is correctly set up with the necessary dependencies.
2.  **Navigation:** Implement the main navigation structure with tabs or a drawer navigator, including:
    *   Home/Feed
    *   Training Hub
    *   Sponsors
    *   Profile
3.  **UI Components:** Create reusable UI components for:
    *   Posts
    *   Training exercises
    *   Sponsorship packages
    *   User profiles
    *   Cards
    *   Buttons
4.  **Screens:** Develop the following screens:
    *   Startseite / Feed
    *   Training Hub
    *   Training erstellen
    *   Sponsoren entdecken
    *   Sponsorenpaket erstellen
    *   Profil (eigen & andere)
    *   Freunde / Anfragen
    *   Nachrichten
    *   Benachrichtigungen
    *   Einstellungen
    *   Admin Dashboard
5.  **Data Models:** Define data models for:
    *   Users (Trainer, Verein, Sponsor, Admin)
    *   Training exercises
    *   Sponsorship packages
    *   Posts
    *   Comments
    *   Messages
6.  **Implement Basic Functionality:**
    *   Implement the social feed with dummy data.
    *   Create a basic Training Hub display.
    *   Set up the user profile screen.
7.  **Implement User Roles:**
    *   Implement the different user roles.
8.  **Implement Training Hub:**
    *   Implement the Training Hub with the fields specified by the user.
9.  **Implement Sponsoring Marketplace:**
    *   Implement the Sponsoring Marketplace with the functions specified by the user.

Now, I will instruct the coding agent to implement the plan and modify the app/(tabs) folder to implement the changes and make the changes visible for the user.
Also, the modalDemos array from app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx should be removed.
I'll create KickR, a comprehensive social media platform for the football community. Let me start by searching for relevant patterns and then reading the existing code structure.
Now I'll create the KickR social media platform for football. This is a comprehensive app with multiple features, so I'll build it systematically with proper structure.
Now let me create the main screens:
Now let me create the iOS-specific files:

Perfect! I've created **KickR**, a comprehensive social media platform for the football community. Here's what I've built:

## 🎯 **Features Implemented:**

### **1. Social Feed (Home Screen)**
- Facebook-style news feed with posts
- Like, comment, and share functionality
- User profiles with avatars
- Create post button
- Real-time interaction updates

### **2. Training Hub**
- Training exercises with detailed information
- Fields: Title, Goal, Team Category, Gender, Duration, Player Count, Materials, Description
- Like, comment, and save functionality
- Filter by training goals (Technik, Taktik, Passspiel, Pressing)
- Create training button

### **3. Sponsoring Marketplace**
- Sponsorship packages (Bronze, Silver, Gold)
- Package details: Price, Duration, Region, Benefits
- Request functionality for sponsors
- Create package button for clubs/trainers
- Filter by package types

### **4. User Profiles**
- User information with avatar
- Role badges (Trainer, Verein, Sponsor, Admin)
- Friends list
- Statistics (Friends, Posts, Trainings)
- Settings menu
- Edit profile button

## 🎨 **Design:**
- **Modern, sporty design** with green (#2ecc71) as primary color
- **Clean white background** with card-based layout
- **Smooth interactions** with proper touch feedback
- **Mobile-first** approach with proper spacing
- **Football-themed** icons and elements

## 📱 **Navigation:**
- 4-tab bottom navigation:
  - **Feed** - Social posts
  - **Training** - Training exercises
  - **Sponsoren** - Sponsorship marketplace
  - **Profil** - User profile

## 🔧 **Technical Features:**
- TypeScript types for all data models
- Mock data for demonstration
- Reusable card components
- Platform-specific files for iOS
- Proper state management
- Responsive design

## 📊 **User Roles:**
The app supports 4 user roles (defined in types):
- **Admin** - Full platform management
- **Trainer** - Post trainings, create posts
- **Verein (Club)** - Create sponsorship packages
- **Sponsor** - Browse and request packages

## 🚀 **Next Steps:**
To make this a fully functional app, you would need to:

1. **Enable Supabase** for backend functionality:
   - User authentication
   - Database for posts, trainings, packages
   - Real-time updates
   - File storage for images/videos

2. **Add more screens**:
   - Create post screen
   - Create training screen
   - Create package screen
   - Messages/Chat screen
   - Notifications screen
   - Admin dashboard

3. **Implement real features**:
   - Image/video upload
   - Push notifications
   - Search functionality
   - Friend requests system
   - Deal management

The foundation is now complete with a beautiful, modern UI and all the core components ready to use! 🎉⚽

content.message: feat: Implement core UI and components for KickR football app

content.text: Füge das Logo von Kickr ein

Here's the plan to integrate the KickR logo into your app:

1.  **Logo Integration**: I will add the KickR logo, located at `/expo-project/assets/images/d332ec97-81cd-453c-a68f-f9db9a18798f.png`, to the app. I will place it in the header of each main screen (Home/Feed, Training Hub, Sponsors, and Profile) to maintain consistent branding.
I'll add the KickR logo to the header of each main screen. Let me first read the current screen files to understand their structure.

Perfect! I can see the structure of all the screens. Now I'll add the KickR logo to the header of each screen. The logo is already available at `/expo-project/assets/images/d332ec97-81cd-453c-a68f-f9db9a18798f.png`. I'll update all the screen files to include the logo in the header.

Perfect! I've successfully integrated the KickR logo into all the main screens of your app. Here's what I did:

## Changes Made:

1. **Home/Feed Screen** (both `.tsx` and `.ios.tsx`):
   - Added the KickR logo image at the top of the header
   - Replaced the text "KickR" title with the logo
   - Centered the logo and kept the subtitle below it

2. **Training Hub Screen** (both `.tsx` and `.ios.tsx`):
   - Added the KickR logo to the header
   - Kept the subtitle "Lerne von anderen Trainern"

3. **Sponsors Screen** (both `.tsx` and `.ios.tsx`):
   - Added the KickR logo to the header
   - Kept the subtitle "Finde die perfekte Partnerschaft"

4. **Profile Screen** (both `.tsx` and `.ios.tsx`):
   - Added the KickR logo to the header
   - Removed the text title to give the logo more prominence

The logo is displayed at 200x50 pixels with `resizeMode="contain"` to maintain its aspect ratio, and it's centered in the green header on all screens. The logo provides consistent branding across your entire KickR app! ⚽

content.message: feat: Add KickR logo to the header of all main screens

content.text: Erstelle dass die App ungefähr so aussieht. Nur das Menü soll weiter unten zu sehen sein.

Okay, I understand you want to adjust the app's appearance and move the menu to the bottom.

Here's what we'll do:

1.  Adjust the layout to match your desired look.
2.  Ensure the tab menu (navigation) is positioned at the bottom of the screen.
I'll help you adjust the app's appearance and move the menu to the bottom. Let me first check the current structure and then make the necessary changes.
Now let me check the iOS-specific layout and home screen:

Perfect! I can see the current structure. Based on your request "Erstelle dass die App ungefähr so aussieht. Nur das Menü soll weiter unten zu sehen sein" (Create the app to look approximately like this. Only the menu should be visible further down), I understand you want to ensure the bottom navigation menu is properly positioned at the bottom of the screen.

Looking at the current code, I can see that:
1. The FloatingTabBar is already positioned at the bottom
2. All screens have proper padding at the bottom (paddingBottom: 100) to avoid content being hidden by the tab bar
3. The iOS version uses native tabs which are automatically at the bottom

However, I'll make some adjustments to ensure the layout is optimal and the menu is clearly visible at the bottom:

Perfect! I've made the following improvements to ensure the menu is properly positioned at the bottom:

## Changes Made:

1. **Enhanced FloatingTabBar Component:**
   - Increased tab bar height from 60px to 68px for better visibility
   - Made the tab bar wider (380px instead of 360px) for better touch targets
   - Increased icon size from 24px to 26px for better visibility
   - Improved label font size and weight for better readability
   - Enhanced the visual indicator with better colors and sizing
   - Added better border styling for both light and dark modes

2. **Updated iOS Native Tabs:**
   - Added all 4 tabs (Feed, Training, Sponsoren, Profil) to match Android
   - Used appropriate SF Symbols for iOS icons

3. **Improved Bottom Padding:**
   - Increased `paddingBottom` from 100px to 120px on all screens to ensure content doesn't get hidden behind the tab bar
   - This applies to: Home, Training, Sponsors, and Profile screens (both iOS and Android versions)

4. **Better Visual Design:**
   - The tab bar now has a more prominent appearance with better contrast
   - Active tab indicators are more visible
   - Icons and labels are larger and easier to read

The menu is now clearly visible at the bottom of the screen with proper spacing, and all content scrolls comfortably above it without being hidden. The design maintains the modern, clean look of your KickR football social media platform!
